post.summary: BannerQuote returns the quote of the day.

DevShareInstanceBertyID shares your Berty ID on a dev channel.
TODO: remove for public.
DevStreamLogs streams logs from the ring-buffer.
Use to test duplex stream.
Use to test stream.
InstanceExportData exports instance data
InstanceShareableBertyID returns a Berty ID that can be shared as a string, QR code or deep link.
InteractionReactionsForEmoji returns a list of reactions on an interaction for a specific emoji
ListMemberDevices Lists devices for a member
MediaGetRelated Gets previous/next media to be played after current
MediaPrepare allows to upload a file and returns a cid to attach to messages
MediaRetrieve allows to download a file attached to a message
MessageSearch

ParseDeepLink parses a link in the form of berty://xxx or https://berty.tech/id# and returns a structure
that can be used to display information.
This action is read-only.
PushReceive handles a push payload, decrypts it if possible, adds it to the local store
PushSetAutoShare Sets whether new groups should receive our push token automatically or not
PushShareTokenForConversation Share a push token for a conversation
PushTokenSharedForConversation
ReplicationServiceRegisterGroup Asks a replication service to distribute a group contents
ReplicationSetAutoEnable Sets whether new groups should be replicated automatically or not
SendContactRequest takes the payload received from ParseDeepLink and send a contact request using the Berty Protocol.
SendReplyOptions sends a list of prefilled response options to a group.
ServicesTokenList Retrieves the list of service server tokens
ShareableBertyGroup returns a Berty Group that can be shared as a string, QR code or deep link.
SystemInfo returns runtime information.
TyberHostAttach
TyberHostSearch

kind.description: kind is a clear representation of the unencrypted link type.

nonce.description:
nonce is a clear field used by scrypt as "salt" to derive the passphrase and
also used by cipher.NewCTR as "iv" to initialize a stream cipher.

display_name.description: display_name is an optional clear representation of the display name.

checksum.description:
checksum is an optional field used to check if the decryption was successful.
the length is customizable (SHAKE256). a longer checksum means less conflicts.
having more conflicts may be bad in term of UX, but make it easier for an attacker
to run an offline bruteforce.

BertyLinkEncrypted.description:
Encrypted is a clear structure containing clear and encrypted fields.

We prefer to use a clear struct with encrypted fields instead of a simple
encrypted struct, to improves chances of having a valid structure even
with an invalid passphase. This will force an attacker to have more resources
to test more false-positive guesses.

v1AppMessageType.title: - TypeMonitorMetadata: these shouldn't be sent on the network

passphrase.title: optional passphase to decrypt the link

last_update.title: last_update is used to sort conversations, it should be updated for each "visible" event

info_date.title: info_date is used when SetGroupInfo is called

passphrase.title: optional passphase to decrypt the link

reset.title: reset will regenerate a new link

public_key.title: public_key is the identifier of the group, it signs the group secret and the initial member of a multi-member group

secret.title: secret is the symmetric secret of the group, which is used to encrypt the metadata

secret_sig.title: secret_sig is the signature of the secret used to ensure the validity of the group

group_type.title: group_type specifies the type of the group, used to determine how device secrets are generated

sign_pub.title: sign_pub is the signature public key used to verify entries, not required when secret and secret_sig are provided

link_key.title: link_key is the secret key used to exchange group updates and links to attachments, useful for replication services

link_key_sig.title: link_key_sig is the signature of the link_key using the group private key

v1Group.title: Group define a group and is enough to invite someone to it

v1GroupType.description:
- GroupTypeUndefined: GroupTypeUndefined indicates that the value has not been set. For example, happens if group is replicated.
 - GroupTypeAccount: GroupTypeAccount is the group managing an account, available to all its devices.
 - GroupTypeContact: GroupTypeContact is the group created between two accounts, available to all their devices.
 - GroupTypeMultiMember: GroupTypeMultiMember is a group containing an undefined number of members.

reset.title: reset will regenerate a new link

passphrase.title: optional passphase to encrypt the link

interaction_cid.title: these should not be sent on the bertyprotocol layer

mime_types.title: bool previous = 2; // TODO: gets previous media instead of next

v1MediaState.title:
- StateNeverDownloaded: specific to media received
 - StatePrepared: specific to media sent

amount.description: amount Number of entries to be returned. Default is 5.

ref_cid.description: ref_cid Reference CID for used for pagination defaulting to oldest/newest depending on sorting. When specified this CID won't be included in the results.

conversation_pk.title: conversation_pk Filter by conversation, otherwise X latest message of each conversation are returned

oldest_to_newest.title: oldest_to_newest Default sort of results is latest to oldest message

exclude_medias.title: exclude_medias Medias are included by default

no_bulk.title: no_bulk should interactions be via atomic update in the stream

passphrase.title: optional passphase to decrypt the link
